case_vignette: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency room complaining of left shoulder pain for several weeks. He says that the pain often worsens when he tries to sleep on his left side. Although he tried several pain medications, none of the pain medications helped. He is an amateur tennis player who practices on weekends. He denies any trauma during his practice sessions. On examination of the shoulder joint, severe tenderness was present localized to the greater tuberosity of the left shoulder joint along with biceps tendon tenderness over the bicipital groove. The range of motion was limited to the left side. An X-ray of the joint showed narrowing of the acromiohumeral space with sclerosis and spurring of the acromion. Routine blood test results are normal except for the rheumatoid factor, which is positive.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having pain in my left shoulder for several weeks, and it gets worse when I try to sleep on that side.
How old are you?
I'm 27 years old.
Do you have any history of autoimmune diseases?
I haven't mentioned any history of autoimmune diseases.
Do you have a family history of autoimmune diseases?
I haven't mentioned any family history of autoimmune diseases.
Have you experienced any morning stiffness or swelling in your left shoulder?
I haven't mentioned experiencing morning stiffness or swelling in my shoulder.
Do you take any medications for any other medical conditions?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications for other medical conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Frozen Shoulder (Adhesive Capsulitis)
